text: Alexander Sergeevich Spirin (Russian: Александр Сергеевич Спирин) (4 September 1931 – 30 December 2020) was a Russian biochemist. He was a Distinguished Professor at the Lomonosov Moscow State University. His works focused on nucleic acids and protein biosynthesis. In 1974 he was elected a Member of the German Academy of Sciences Leopoldina. He was elected a foreign associate of the US National Academy of Sciences in April 2019. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1990. Spirin died on 30 December 2020 at the age of 89.Светлая память Спирину Александру Сергеевичу ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Russian chemists Category:Moscow State University faculty Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Alexander Spirin
